userStories.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
userStories.tip: Talking about it. It was surprising to me how many of my co-workers, acquaintances and friends suffer from anxiety just like me.

userStories.question: What’s your best coping strategy?
userStories.tip: Playing online games or watching reality tv. Taking a walk outside. Anything distracting.

userStories.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
userStories.tip: Reaching out to friends.

userStories.question: What’s your best coping strategy?
userStories.tip: It has become an integral part of who I am, down to my very core, to try to see a "silver lining" when things go wrong; even if that lining has nothing to do with the problem you're having at the time, think of 1 positive aspect of your life.  Also, be mindful - live in this moment, and allow yourself to move onto the next.

condition.description:
Some anxiety is useful. It can make you more alert or careful. People with Generalized Anxiety Disorder have excessive, ongoing fear or worry that interferes with their day-to-day life, school or work, and relationships. Researchers don't know exactly what causes it, but several parts of the brain are associated with fear and worry. Symptoms include

  • Persistent worry that's out of proportion to the cause or event
  • Feeling constantly on edge or irritable
  • Inability to let go of a worry
  • Worrying about worrying
  • Excessive difficulty making decisions
  • Trouble falling asleep or staying asleep
  • Physical symptoms such as fatigue, headaches, muscle tension, sweating, nausea, irritable bowel syndrome, trembling, or twitchiness

A psychiatrist usually diagnoses Generalized Anxiety Disorder by talking to you and administering a questionnaire that assesses your symptoms. It's typically treated with a combination of medications, therapy (such as talk therapy or Cognitive Behavioral Therapy), and mindfulness or relaxation exercises. Getting regular exercise is also effective at reducing anxiety.

basics.benefits_moa: Hydroxyzine is an antihistamine. It treats allergy symptoms by stopping the effects of histamine in the body.  It's also used to control anxiety before surgery.
basics.bottom_line: Hydroxyzine is an effective treatment for the itching caused by an allergic reaction. It can also help treat mild anxiety.
downsides: The dose of Hydroxyzine should be reduced for people who are older or who have reduced liver or kidney function.
Hydroxyzine can cause confusion, dry mouth, constipation, and urinary side effects. These symptoms are worse in older people.
As with some medicines, the tablets contain lactose. If you’re lactose intolerant, you could be sensitive to this.
Not recommended if you’re pregnant or breastfeeding.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Hydroxyzine lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful and avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Risk to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Hydroxyzine can cause birth defects. It's not clear, but the risk may be greater early in pregnancy. Since it's not known if Hydroxyzine passes into breast milk, breast-feeding isn't recommended. Don't use Hydroxyzine while pregnant and if you're considering having a baby and talk to your doctor about alternative medications. If antihistamines are needed to treat severe itching, second generation medicines may be preferred.

risks_warnings.title: Increased side effects
risks_warnings.description: Hydroxyzine is considered a high risk medicine in older people. It can increase the risk of falls, worsen glaucoma, urinary, and prostate problems. If you take Hydroxyzine, use the lowest possible dose and watch for side effects like confusion, dry mouth, constipation, or problems urinating. It’s better to use short-term for severe itching than for long-term treatment of anxiety.

basics.benefits_moa: Ativan is a fast-acting benzodiazepine. It affects neurotransmitters in the brain and calms the nervous system. This reduces anxiety and can cause sleepiness.
basics.bottom_line: Ativan is okay for occasional or short-term use (up to 4 weeks) for anxiety and sleep. Less likely to have drug interactions, but more likely to cause withdrawal symptoms compared to similar drugs.
downsides: Can cause memory problems, drowsiness, dizziness, and confusion.
Can be habit-forming, so it's not typically used for long-term treatment, or for people who've had problems with drug or alcohol abuse.
Compared to other benzodiazepines, more likely to cause withdrawal if you take it for a long time and then stop suddenly.
Most people find that it gets less effective over time.

risks_warnings.title: Tolerance and dependence
risks_warnings.description: If you use Ativan for 4 weeks or more, it's likely that your body will develop tolerance to it, which means that more and more of the medication is needed to achieve the same effect. You're also likely to become physically dependent on the medication, which means that you'll feel withdrawal symptoms if you stop taking it all at once. You can avoid withdrawal by weaning off of the medication very slowly with the help of a doctor. Take only the prescribed dose to minimize risks of abuse and overdose. Ativan should not be used by people with a history of drug abuse if an alternative medication is available.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Ativan suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and muscle pain or burning. Withdrawal symptoms can last 6 weeks or longer. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

basics.bottom_line: Cymbalta is good for treating depression and anxiety, and may help with chronic pain. More likely than other antidepressants to cause problems if you drink or have high blood pressure.
downsides: Not a good option if you're a heavy drinker, or if you have liver or kidney problems.

drugs.name: Cymbalta

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take with food to avoid upset stomach.
Full effects in 8 to 12 weeks for mood, 2 weeks for pain.
Stop taking slowly to avoid withdrawal symptoms.
Tell your doctor if you notice sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Cymbalta may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Cymbalta is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

description_processed.orig: Cymbalta may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Cymbalta is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Cymbalta with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.
risk_factors: Using other medications that affect serotonin

description_processed.orig: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Cymbalta with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Cymbalta suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1 to 2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Cymbalta suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1 to 2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Cymbalta can increase your blood pressure. Monitor your blood pressure regularly.

description_processed.orig: Cymbalta can increase your blood pressure. Monitor your blood pressure regularly.

risks_warnings.title: Increased bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Cymbalta can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

description_processed.orig: Cymbalta can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

risks_warnings.title: Sexual dysfunction
risks_warnings.description: Cymbalta can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

description_processed.orig: Cymbalta can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

risks_warnings.title: Mania
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

You can take the extended-release form once a day with food either in the morning or in the evening at about the same time each day.
Extended-release capsules should be swallowed whole. If you can’t swallow pills, open the capsule, sprinkle it on a spoonful of applesauce and then swallow it without chewing.
Stop taking it slowly to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.
Tell your doctor if you notice sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.

basics.benefits_moa: Venlafaxine is a serotonin and norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (SNRI) antidepressant. It increases serotonin and norepinephrine activity in the brain, which regulate mood.
basics.bottom_line: Venlafaxine is good for treating depression and anxiety. May work when other antidepressants haven't, it's but more likely to cause side effects and withdrawal symptoms than other antidepressants.
downsides: Can cause sexual side effects like low libido and an inability to orgasm or ejaculate.
Not the best option for people with high blood pressure.
Overdosing on this medication could be fatal.
It's more likely to cause nausea and vomiting or make you feel sick if you miss a dose than other antidepressants. Also causes more sleepiness than others.
Like most antidepressants, it can cause a higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people younger than 24.
The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work or it can cause side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medications until you find one that works for you.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Venlafaxine may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Venlafaxine is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

description_processed.orig: Venlafaxine may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Venlafaxine with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Venlafaxine suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1 to 2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

risks_warnings.title: Increased bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Venlafaxine can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

risks_warnings.title: Sexual dysfunction
risks_warnings.description: Venlafaxine can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

basics.benefits_moa: Lexapro is a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) antidepressant. It increases serotonin activity in the brain, which regulates mood.
basics.bottom_line: Lexapro is good for treating depression and anxiety. Might be less likely to cause side effects than some antidepressants, but not the best choice for people with heart or liver problems.
downsides: Can cause sexual side effects like low libido and an inability to orgasm or ejaculate.
More likely to cause minor weight gain (1 to 5 pounds) than other antidepressants.
Can cause an irregular heartbeat if you take a high dose (20 mg a day, or more).
Not a good option for you if you have heart or liver problems.
Like most antidepressants, it can cause a higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people younger than 24.

The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work, and might have side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medicines until you find one that works for you and that you can tolerate.

drugs.name: Paxil

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take with food to avoid upset stomach.
Takes about 8 to 12 weeks to see the medication's full effects on your mood.
Stop taking it slowly to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.
Tell your doctor if you notice sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.
The controlled-release (CR) tablet can cause less nausea than other forms.
Don’t crush, break, or chew the Paxil controlled-release tablet or the Pexeva film-coated tablets.
It’s best to take Paxil in the morning, except Brisdelle, which can be taken at bedtime.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Paxil may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Paxil is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

description_processed.orig: Paxil may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Paxil is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Paxil with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Paxil suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1 to 2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

risks_warnings.title: Increased bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Paxil can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

risks_warnings.title: Sexual dysfunction
risks_warnings.description: Paxil can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

description_processed.orig: Paxil can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

risks_warnings.title: Mania
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

description_processed.orig: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. risks_warnings.title: Pregnancy
risks_warnings.description: Paxil can harm a developing fetus. Don't use it while pregnant, especially in the first trimester. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

basics.benefits_moa: Valium is a fast-acting benzodiazepine. It affects neurotransmitters in the brain and calms the nervous system. This reduces anxiety and muscle spasms, and causes sleepiness.
basics.bottom_line: Valium is okay for occasional or short-term use (up to 4 weeks) for anxiety and for pain and sleeplessness from muscle spasm. Less severe withdrawal symptoms compared to similar drugs.
downsides: Processed by the liver, so might not be the best choice if you have liver problems.
Can cause memory problems, drowsiness, dizziness, and confusion.
Can be habit-forming, so it's not typically used for long-term treatment, or for people who've had problems with drug or alcohol abuse.
Most people find that it gets less effective over time.

carousel_items_processed.orig: Good for short-term relief of anxiety symptoms.
Starts working in 30 minutes when swallowed.

Addictive. Long-term use can cause dependence or abuse.

risks_warnings.title: Tolerance and dependence
risks_warnings.description: If you use Valium for 4 weeks or more, it's likely that your body will develop tolerance to it, which means that more and more of the medication is needed to achieve the same effect. You're also likely to become physically dependent on the medication, which means that you'll feel withdrawal symptoms if you stop taking it all at once. You can avoid withdrawal by weaning off of the medication very slowly with the help of a doctor. Take only the prescribed dose to minimize risks of abuse and overdose. Valium should not be used by people with a history of drug abuse if an alternative medication is available.

risks_warnings.title: Pregnancy
risks_warnings.description: Valium can harm a developing fetus. The baby can become dependent on the medicine and go through withdrawal after birth. Don't use Valium while pregnant.

carousel_items_processed.orig: Good for short-term relief of anxiety symptoms.
Starts working in 45 minutes when swallowed.

risks_warnings.title: Dependence and withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Xanax has a risk of physical and psychological dependence. The risk is greater if you take more than 4 mg per day or use it longer than 12 weeks. Decreasing the dose or stopping the medication can make panic attacks and anxiety come back just as bad or worse than before starting treatment, or cause withdrawal symptoms including seizures, confusion, muscle cramps and twitching, diarrhea, and blurred vision. The risk of seizures is greatest 24 to 72 hours after the last dose. Get help from a doctor to increase your dose or discontinue treatment; it's dangerous to do so on your own. Don't use alcohol or drugs while taking Xanax.

basics.benefits_moa: Metoprolol tartrate is a beta blocker. It lowers blood pressure by slowing heart rate, relaxing blood vessels, and lowering the body's fight-or-flight response.
basics.bottom_line: Metoprolol tartrate is good for controlling chest pain and treating heart failure and heart attack. You have to take it with food, and you can't miss doses.
downsides: Metoprolol tartrate is the immediate release version of Toprol XL. You have to take Metoprolol tartrate with food for it to work best. (On the other hand, you can take Toprol XL any time.)
Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Metoprolol tartrate suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of low blood sugar
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Metoprolol tartrate who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Metoprolol tartrate.

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of overactive thyroid
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Metoprolol tartrate who also have overactive thyroid may not recognize the signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Don't stop taking Metoprolol tartrate suddenly without talking to your doctor, since this can cause worse thyroid problems.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Metoprolol tartrate who also have overactive thyroid may not recognize the signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Don't stop taking Metoprolol tartrate suddenly without talking to your doctor, since this can cause worse thyroid problems.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack
risks_warnings.description: Don't stop taking Metoprolol tartrate suddenly without talking to your doctor if you have coronary artery disease, since chest pain (angina) can increase suddenly or trigger a heart attack.

description_processed.orig: Don't stop taking Metoprolol tartrate suddenly without talking to your doctor if you have coronary artery disease, since chest pain (angina) can increase suddenly or trigger a heart attack.

risks_warnings.title: Increased symptoms of heart failure
risks_warnings.description: Worsening symptoms of heart failure, such as increased swelling in your arms and legs, can occur if your doctor decides to increase your dosage of Metoprolol tartrate. Your doctor can work with you to minimize these effects.

description_processed.orig: Worsening symptoms of heart failure, such as increased swelling in your arms and legs, can occur if your doctor decides to increase your dosage of Metoprolol tartrate. Your doctor can work with you to minimize these effects.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risks during surgery
risks_warnings.description: If you're planning to undergo a major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Metoprolol tartrate, so they can monitor your heart closely.

description_processed.orig: If you're planning to undergo a major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Metoprolol tartrate, so they can monitor your heart closely.

risks_warnings.title: Trouble breathing (bronchospastic disease)
risks_warnings.description: Metoprolol tartrate has a beta blocker (metoprolol) that is generally not recommended for people with bronchospastic disease, like asthma, because it can trigger difficulty breathing. Metoprolol tartrate should only be used under careful supervision of a doctor.

basics.benefits_moa: Lyrica is a nerve pain reliever. Researchers don't know exactly how it works, but it has a similar structure to GABA, a neurotransmitter that calms nerves in the brain and spinal cord.
basics.bottom_line: Lyrica works well as an add-on medicine for seizures and fibromyalgia, but it's especially effective for nerve-related pain after shingles. Not available as a generic, so it might be expensive.
downsides: Not available as a generic, so it can be pricey.
You can't skip or miss doses since suddenly stopping Lyrica can cause seizures.
Lyrica is likely to cause some side effects, including memory problems, drowsiness, dizziness, and confusion.

Has a higher risk than other pain medicines of affecting your heart rate or rhythm, so it might not be the best choice if you have cardiovascular disease (previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heartbeat).

downsides_processed.orig: Not available as a generic, so it can be pricey.

upsides: Relieves nerve-related (neuropathic) pain caused by different conditions including diabetes, shingles (herpes zoster), fibromyalgia, and spinal cord damage.
Studies show that lower doses of Lyrica cause fewer side effects and still relieve pain just as well as higher doses.
Also used in combination with other medications to treat epilepsy (partial seizures).

userStories.tip: Patience.  The side effects are just temporary.  They soon will pass and the benefits will far outweigh any side effects, if any.

This is a medication that one cannot readily judge its effectiveness in just a few weeks. yes the first few days that I  was taking Lyrica I  cried as my vision was out of focus, my inability to stay focused at work was nearly impossible. As for driving,  I quickly realized that I should not be behind the wheel.   I questioned whether this pharmaceutical marvel was really all that it was cracked up to be as I felt no better and my side effects were worse.   After a few weeks I found that the ill effects has passed and i started feeling relief.   (I have a spinal cord injury that has left me with peripheral neuropathy in both of my legs and feet )  After nearly 6 years of treatment and increasing dosages carefully monitored by my pain management doctor,  I am not sure what I would do if it were not for Lyrica.
Really good medication to treat anxiety but rather expensive.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Lyrica is only approved for use in adults. It can increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Report new or worsening depression or unusual changes in mood or behavior to your doctor right away, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Lyrica impairs your ability to focus, think, react and can cause blurred vision. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Lyrica impairs your ability to focus, think, react and can cause blurred vision. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Unusual swelling
risks_warnings.description: Angioedema, or swelling in the face, lip, tongue, throat, and/or other organs can happen at anytime when taking Lyrica. Get medical help immediately if you develop any head/neck swelling or abdominal pain that does not go away.
risk_factors: Taking other medications that can angioedema

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Lyrica has a higher risk of affecting heart rate control. If you have a history of cardiovascular disease (including previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heartbeat), talk to your doctor before using Lyrica.

description_processed.orig: Lyrica has a higher risk of affecting heart rate control. If you have a history of cardiovascular disease (including previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heartbeat), talk to your doctor before using Lyrica.

risks_warnings.title: Foot and leg swelling
risks_warnings.description: Lyrica may cause swelling in the limbs. It's more common in feet, ankles, or legs, but can occur in the arms. Swelling can be worse if you are taking certain diabetes medications or if you have conditions that make you prone to it. If Lyrica does cause swelling, it should improve when you stop taking the medication, but if it doesn't do away, talk to your about other medication choices.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Lyrica suddenly can increase the number of seizures and other symptoms including: nausea, headache, sweating and diarrhea.  Talk to your doctor before making any changes to your medication. It is safer to reduce the dose slowly over at least one week before stopping medication.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Lyrica suddenly can increase the number of seizures and other symptoms including: nausea, headache, sweating and diarrhea. risks_warnings.title: Muscle pain
risks_warnings.description: Some people taking Lyrica develop muscle damage leading to kidney failure (rhabdomyolysis), however, this is very rare. Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, weakness or fever and there is no other related cause.

description_processed.orig: Some people taking Lyrica develop muscle damage leading to kidney failure (rhabdomyolysis), however, this is very rare. Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, weakness or fever and there is no other related cause.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Don't use while pregnant because it can harm your unborn baby. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about other medication you can take. The same warning applies to men taking Lyrica and possible risk to an unborn baby.
risk_factors: Both male and females taking Lyrica

basics.benefits_moa: Propranolol is an alpha and beta blocker. It lowers blood pressure by slowing heart rate, relaxing blood vessels, and lowering the body's fight-or-flight response.
basics.bottom_line: Propranolol is good for treating many heart problems and other problems in the body, but it has more side effects than other beta blockers. You can't miss doses.
downsides: Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.
Has more side effects than some beta blockers because it crosses into the brain and central nervous system.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Propranolol suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

downsides_processed.orig: Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.
Has more side effects than some beta blockers because it crosses into the brain and central nervous system.

You can't miss doses. Stopping Propranolol suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

upsides: A first-choice treatment to prevent chest pain (angina).
A first-choice treatment for heart failure, heart attack, heart valve disorders, and abnormal heart rhythm.
Also treats and prevents many non-heart problems, such as tremors, anxiety, migraines, and liver disease symptoms.

basics.benefits_moa: Mirtazapine is an atypical antidepressant. It stimulates your body to make certain chemicals in the brain, such as serotonin and norepinephrine, which regulate mood.
basics.bottom_line: Mirtazapine is okay for treating depression and good for sleep. More likely to cause weight gain than any other antidepressant.
downsides: Not as effective as other medications for depression.

risks_warnings.description: Mirtazapine may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Mirtazapine with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Tolerance and dependence
risks_warnings.description: If you use Temazepam for 4 weeks or more, it's likely that your body will develop tolerance to it, which means that more and more of the medication is needed to achieve the same effect. You're also likely to become physically dependent on the medication, meaning you'll feel withdrawal symptoms if you stop taking it all at once. You can avoid withdrawal by weaning off of the medication very slowly with the help of a doctor. Take only the prescribed dose to minimize risks of abuse and overdose. Temazepam shouldn't be used by people with a history of drug abuse if an alternative medication is available.

risks_warnings.description: Studies have shown that Zoloft increases the risk of bone fractures. It's not known why.

description_processed.orig: Studies have shown that Zoloft increases the risk of bone fractures. It's not known why.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Withdrawal symptoms may occur if you decrease the dose or stop Zoloft suddenly. Symptoms include nausea, dizziness, muscle aches, fatigue, chills, anxiety, and irritability. Gradually reduce your dose to avoid withdrawal.

description_processed.orig: Withdrawal symptoms may occur if you decrease the dose or stop Zoloft suddenly. Symptoms include nausea, dizziness, muscle aches, fatigue, chills, anxiety, and irritability. Gradually reduce your dose to avoid withdrawal.

risks_warnings.title: Abnormal bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Zoloft may increase risk of bleeding, bruising, or bleeding in the gut. Be careful taking it with blood-thinning drugs such as warfarin, aspirin, or nonsteroidal anti-inflammatories (like ibuprofen).

description_processed.orig: Zoloft may increase risk of bleeding, bruising, or bleeding in the gut. Be careful taking it with blood-thinning drugs such as warfarin, aspirin, or nonsteroidal anti-inflammatories (like ibuprofen).

risks_warnings.title: Low sodium levels in the blood
risks_warnings.description: Zoloft may increase the risk of low sodium levels in the blood (hyponatremia). Watch out for symptoms including headache, difficulty concentrating, memory problems, confusion, weakness, and unsteadiness, which may lead to falls. Talk to a doctor right away before developing more serious symptoms, such as hallucination, fainting, coma, and death.

carousel_items: Good for short-term relief of anxiety symptoms.
Starts working in 45 minutes when swallowed.
Can cause temporary dizziness and drowsiness.
Addictive. Long-term use can cause dependence or abuse.
Not safe to use with alcohol.

clock.tip: Works stronger and faster if taken with food.
Taking with a high-fat meal slows effects.

basics.benefits_moa: Xanax is a fast-acting benzodiazepine. It affects neurotransmitters in the brain and calms the nervous system. This reduces anxiety and can cause sleepiness.
basics.bottom_line: Xanax is okay for occasional or short-term use (up to 4 weeks) for anxiety, and longer-term for panic attacks. More likely to cause withdrawal symptoms compared to similar drugs.
downsides: Processed by the liver, so might not be the best choice if you have liver problems.
Can cause memory problems, drowsiness, dizziness, and confusion.
Can be habit-forming, so it's not typically used for long-term treatment, or for people who've had problems with drug or alcohol abuse.
Compared to other benzodiazepines, more likely to cause withdrawal if you take it for a long time and then stop suddenly.

risks_warnings.title: Dependence and withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Xanax has a risk of physical and psychological dependence. The risk is greater if you take more than 4 mg per day or use it longer than 12 weeks. Decreasing the dose or stopping the medication can make panic attacks and anxiety come back just as bad or worse than before starting treatment, or cause withdrawal symptoms including seizures, confusion, muscle cramps and twitching, diarrhea, and blurred vision. The risk of seizures is greatest 24 to 72 hours after the last dose. Get help from a doctor to increase your dose or discontinue treatment; it's dangerous to do so on your own. Don't use alcohol or drugs while taking Xanax.

Don't use alcohol or drugs while taking Xanax.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Xanax may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for the start or worsening of depression, suicidal thoughts or behavior, or any unusual changes in mood or behavior.

description_processed.orig: Xanax may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for the start or worsening of depression, suicidal thoughts or behavior, or any unusual changes in mood or behavior.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Xanax impairs thinking abilities (concentration, alertness) and physical abilities (reflexes, motor skills) needed to drive a car, operate machinery, or participate in potentially dangerous activities. Be careful.

description_processed.orig: Xanax impairs thinking abilities (concentration, alertness) and physical abilities (reflexes, motor skills) needed to drive a car, operate machinery, or participate in potentially dangerous activities. Be careful.

risks_warnings.title: Pregnancy
risks_warnings.description: Xanax is potentially hazardous to a developing fetus and shouldn't be used during the first trimester of pregnancy. Tell your doctor if you think you might be pregnant before you start taking it.

risks_warnings.title: Increased side effects
risks_warnings.description: Xanax is processed by the liver. If you have liver problems, you may need a different dose to prevent increased risk for side effects.

surveys.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
surveys.tip: Talking about it. It was surprising to me how many of my co-workers, acquaintances and friends suffer from anxiety just like me.

surveys.question: What’s your best coping strategy?
surveys.tip: Playing online games or watching reality tv. Taking a walk outside. Anything distracting.

surveys.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
What’s your best coping strategy?
surveys.tip: It has become an integral part of who I am, down to my very core, to try to see a "silver lining" when things go wrong; even if that lining has nothing to do with the problem you're having at the time, think of 1 positive aspect of your life.  Also, be mindful - live in this moment, and allow yourself to move onto the next.

surveys.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
surveys.tip: Try as hard as you can to find something/anything positive.  Whether it's writing 1 to 3 things that you're grateful for, watching a funny movie, or thinking about someone who does have it worse than you.
